Frequently Asked Questions

What's the standard tip percentage for restaurants?

The standard tip is 15-20% of the bill before tax. 15% for basic service, 18% for good service, and 20% for excellent service. Some people tip 25% or more for exceptional service.

Should I tip on the amount before or after tax?

Traditionally, tips are calculated on the pre-tax amount. However, many people now tip on the total including tax, which is also acceptable. The key is being consistent and fair.

How do I split a bill with multiple people?

Divide the total bill (including tip) by the number of people. Our calculator handles this automatically, showing each person's share of the bill and tip.

What about tipping for delivery and takeout?

For delivery, tip 15-20% of the order total. For takeout, tipping is optional but appreciated, especially during busy times or for large orders.

How do I handle tipping in different countries?

Tipping customs vary by country. In the US, 15-20% is standard. In Europe, 10-15% is common. In Japan, tipping is not customary. Research local customs when traveling.

Tipping Etiquette Tips

  • Tip based on service quality, not just the bill amount
  • Consider the service type (dine-in vs. takeout vs. delivery)
  • Be generous during holidays and special occasions
  • Tip in cash when possible to ensure servers receive it directly
  • Remember that tips are often shared among staff
  • Don't reduce tips for issues beyond the server's control
  • Consider the local economy and cost of living
  • When in doubt, err on the side of generosity
